title: About
text:
Matt Crump is a cognitive psychologist at Brooklyn College of CUNY, and runs the computational cognition lab in the Department of Psychology.
He sometimes makes paintings, pictures, and other visual things.

title: About
text:
Education
Postdoc, Vanderbilt University - 2011 (Psychology)
Ph.D., McMaster University - 2007 (Psychology)
B.Sc., University of Lethbridge - 2002 (Psychology)

title: About
text:
Experience
Assistant Professor - Brooklyn College of CUNY (2011)
Associate Professor - Brooklyn College of CUNY (2016)
Full Professor - Brooklyn College of CUNY (2022)

title: Scribble Picture 1
text:
Process notes
Walk around take pictures of NYC. Bring the RAW image into Adobe lightroom and push it around. Settled on a bleached out color spectrum. Pop the image into Adobe Fresco.
First layer is drawing body parts in black ink. The same pen is used to graffiti text in the image. Body parts are filled. Opacity of layers are adjusted. Add another layer of color stuff for fun.

title: Scribble Picture 17
text:
Process Notes
The creatures are creeping in.
Having fun with these scribble pictures. I didn’t expect to get to the 17th one already.
None of them have been printed yet. I’m looking at a target print size of 24x36. This scribble picture was adjusted to hit that poster size. I’m likely to print with a border, so now there is room for a digital signature outside of the print.
